result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby G. Bearfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Obtain and maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with Francis Duffy or the Four Seasons gas station, or any of it's employees while they are working.  Contact with his brother, Michael Bearfield, is at agent's discretion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

records.addlTxt: from Eau Claire Cty DA

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Victim notification complied with, per DA.  Retail Theft 225 (count 2).  BJ 217(count 1)  BJ 269 (count 2).   All other counts and pending cases to be dismissed, but read in for sentencing purpose.   Defendant plead guilty.    Court recited the charges and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood. Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for 18 mo. probation. Concurrent.  (15CM225 Restitution $8.19, plus surcharge.  J&S, Michael Bearfield. )    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with the 4 Seasons.  No contact with Michael Bearfield.  The victim F.D.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 18 months probation. Concurrent.  (15CM225 Restitution $8.19, plus surcharge.  J&S, Michael Bearfield. )    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with the 4 Seasons or the employees while they are working.  Contact with co-defendant, Michael Bearfield, at agent's discretion.  No contact with the  victim F.D.  CC. DNA surcharge.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  o/m employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.  Follow all treatment and counseling recommendations of the agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-14-2016 01:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  All cases resolved.  JT off.  Schedule plea/sentencing for 1/14/16 at 1:30 on all open cases.

Final pre-trial at 01-11-2016 03:00 pm.
Jury trial at 02-11-2016 09:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Track all open cases together.  Not accepting the global offer of the State's.  Set for jury trial.  15CM225 #1, 15CM217 #2, 15CM269 #3.

This bond includes cases: 15CM225, 15CM217 and 15CM269:    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: victim F. D. or his family members; 4 Seasons Gas Station

Pre-trial conference at 10-14-2015 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  No counsel present.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant stated he understood.  Bond set.  AIA set for 9/21/15 at 9:30 am.

In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.
